security: This document discusses a potential opportunity for PBPRIME (likely a codename for a CIA operation) to cooperate with the new government of Ecuador, including the use of a radio station to combat anti-government propaganda from Cuba. Disclosing this initiative could damage relations with Ecuador or Cuba. Quoting: 'It is the opinion of Identity that this is a golden opportunity for PBPRIME to commence cooperation with a new government in a pro-PBPRIME country...the Ecuadorean Goverment would be most willing for KUBARK to utilize the above radio station.'
summary: A CIA dispatch from October 1960 discusses a report from an ODENVY source (Identity) regarding connections with the new Ecuadorean government and a potential opportunity for cooperation, including the use of a radio station to combat anti-government propaganda from Cuba.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET dispatch, dated October 5, 1960, from the Chief of Station in Quito to the Chief of Base in Guayaquil and Chief of WH, concerns an ODENVY report about an individual (Identity) who claims to have been offered a job representing Ecuador in PBPRIME. Identity relates that he conferred with future leaders of Ecuador who are eager to cooperate with PBPRIME and allow KUBARK to use a planned radio station in Guayaquil to combat anti-government propaganda from Cuba. The dispatch requests the recipients to comment on Identity's statements and activities in Ecuador, especially regarding the offer to represent Ecuador and the potential cooperation with PBPRIME.
title: Report of PBPRIME Citizen on Connections with Ecuadorean Government
recipient: Chief of Base, Guayaquil, Chief, WH
